skill.description: You MUST use this before any creative work - creating features, building components, adding functionality, or modifying behavior. Explores user intent, requirements and design before implementation.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate software design brainstorming skill. All 48 static findings are false positives triggered by documentation text and markdown formatting being misinterpreted as code. The skill contains no executable code, network requests, external commands, or cryptographic operations.

content.value_statement: Transform vague ideas into concrete implementation plans through structured dialogue. This skill guides you from concept to validated design with incremental validation at each step.
actual_capabilities: Explores user requirements through targeted questions
Validates design incrementally in 200-300 word sections
Documents final design to git with proper formatting
Integrates with git worktrees for isolated implementation
limitations: Requires active user participation in Q&A process
Design validation happens section-by-section, not all at once
Focuses on software features, not general brainstorming
Needs existing project context for best results

use_cases.title: Plan new feature implementation
use_cases.description: Transform a vague feature idea into a detailed implementation plan with architecture, components, and testing strategy.

use_cases.title: Define technical requirements
use_cases.description: Work with AI to clarify technical constraints and create implementation-ready specifications for development teams.

use_cases.title: Design MVP architecture
use_cases.description: Explore different technical approaches for your MVP, understanding trade-offs before committing to implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic feature planning
prompt_templates.scenario: I want to add user authentication
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to add user authentication to my web app. Can you help me explore what I need and design the implementation?

prompt_templates.title: Architecture decision
prompt_templates.prompt: I am building a SaaS platform and cannot decide between microservices or monolithic architecture. Help me evaluate the options.

prompt_templates.title: Complex system design
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to add real-time collaborative editing to my document editor. Walk me through the design considerations and implementation approach.

prompt_templates.title: Migration planning
prompt_templates.scenario: Migrating legacy system to new tech stack
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a legacy PHP monolith that needs to be migrated to a modern tech stack. Help me plan the migration strategy and new architecture.

output_examples.input: I want to add a recommendation engine to my e-commerce site
output: Understanding phase: Questions about product catalog size, user behavior data, real-time vs batch processing needs
Approaches presented: Collaborative filtering, content-based, hybrid approach with pros and cons
Design sections: Data collection pipeline, ML model training, real-time inference API, A/B testing framework
Final deliverable: Complete design document in docs/plans/ with implementation timeline

output_examples.input: Help me design a notification system for my app
output: Requirements gathering: Channel preferences, delivery guarantees, volume estimates
Architecture options: Queue-based, event-driven, or polling approaches
Component design: Message queue, notification service, delivery handlers, retry logic
Implementation plan: Database schema, API endpoints, testing strategy

best_practices: Answer questions one at a time for clearer requirements gathering
Be specific about constraints like budget, timeline, and technical limitations
Ask for clarification on any technical terms or business requirements you do not understand
anti_patterns: Do not try to design everything at once - let the skill guide you incrementally
Avoid skipping the exploration phase - understanding requirements prevents rework
Do not accept the first design without reviewing alternatives and trade-offs

faq.question: How long does the brainstorming process take?
faq.answer: Typically 10-20 minutes depending on feature complexity. Simple features may take 5-10 minutes, complex systems 20-30 minutes.

faq.question: Can I use this for non-software projects?
faq.answer: The skill is optimized for software development. While you can try other domains, the questions and design approach are tech-focused.

faq.question: What if I do not know the answers to some questions?
faq.answer: That is fine! Say you do not know and the skill will help you think through the options or make reasonable assumptions.

faq.question: Will the skill write code for me?
faq.answer: No, it designs the architecture and creates implementation plans. For actual coding, use other skills after the design is complete.

faq.question: Do I need to commit the design document?
faq.answer: The skill will offer to commit the design to git, but you can decline if you prefer to keep it local or uncommitted.

faq.question: Can I revisit and modify the design later?
faq.answer: Yes! Run the skill again with your updated requirements or ask it to modify specific parts of an existing design.
